required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of Potential Drug-drug Interactions Between Faldaprevir and the Immunosuppressant Drugs Cyclosporine or Tacrolimus
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of Potential Drug-drug Interactions Between Faldaprevir and Immunosuppressants (Cyclosporine and Tacrolimus) in Healthy Male and Female Subjects (Open-label, Fixed-sequence Trial)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this trial is to investigate the effect of multiple-dose faldaprevir (FDV) on the single-dose pharmacokinetics of cyclosporine or tacrolimus

primary_outcome.measure: AUC 0-infinity (Area Under the Concentration-time Curve of the Cyclo in Plasma Over the Time Interval From 0 Extrapolated to Infinity)
primary_outcome.description: AUC 0-infinity (area under the concentration-time curve of the cyclo in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity). PK sampling (relative to the first cyclo administration [h:min]) Period 1: for cyclo 0:00h, 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 3:00h, 4:00h, 6:00h, 8:00h, 10:00h, 12:00h, 16:00h, 24:00h, 48:00h, 72:00h, 96:00h. period 2 for cyclo 0:00h, 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 3:00h, 4:00h, 6:00h, 8:00h, 10:00h, 12:00h, 16:00h, 24:00h, 48:00h, 72:00h, 96:00h, 120:00h, 144:00h, 168:00h.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Healthy males or females subjects
- Age 18 to 50 years (incl.)
- Body mass index (BMI) 18.5 to 29.9 kg/m2 (incl.)
- Signed and dated written informed consent prior to admission to the study
Exclusion criteria:
- Any finding in the medical examination (including blood pressure, pulse rate or ECG) deviating from normal and judged clinically relevant by the investigator.
- Systolic blood pressure (BP) less than 100 mmHg and more than 140 mmHg.
- Diastolic BP less than 60 mmHg and more than 90 mmHg.
- Pulse rate (PR) less than 50 bpm and more than 90 bpm.
- Any laboratory value outside the reference range that the investigator considers to be of clinical relevance
- Any evidence of a concomitant disease judged clinically relevant by the investigator
- Positive QuantiFERON-TB Gold In-Tube

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The trial was nonrandomised, open-label and fixed-sequence and was performed in 2 separate groups of 2 periods each in healthy male and female volunteers. Treatments for the two periods were in group 1 cyclosporine (cyclo) and cyclo and faldaprevir (FDV), and in Group 2 tacrolimus (tac) and tac and FDV.

group.title: Cyclosporine / Cyclosporine + Faldaprevir
group.description: fixed sequence group 1: single dose of 50 mg cyclo on Day 1 in period 1; treated with FDV 240 mg on Day -7 (loading dose) and 120 mg FDV on Days -6 to 7 and a single dose of 50 mg cyclo on Day 1 in period 2. Mode of administration: oral, with 240 mL water after a meal. A washout period of at least 14 days separated administration of cyclo in the treatment periods.

group.title: Tacrolimus / Tacrolimus + Faldaprevir
group.description: fixed sequence group 2: single dose of 0.5 mg tac on Day 1 in period 1; treated with FDV 240 mg on Day -7 (loading dose) and 120 mg FDV on Days -6 to 7 and a single dose of 0.5 mg tac on Day 1 in period 2. Mode of administration: oral, with 240 mL water after a meal. A washout period of at least 14 days separated administration of cyclo in the treatment periods.

baseline.population: treated set (TS): included all subjects who took at least one dose of study medication during the treatment period.

group.title: Cyclosporine / Cyclosporine + Faldaprevir
group.description: fixed sequence group 1: single dose of 50 mg cyclo on Day 1 in period 1; treated with FDV 240 mg on Day -7 (loading dose) and 120 mg FDV on Days -6 to 7 and a single dose of 50 mg cyclo on Day 1 in period 2. Mode of administration: oral, with 240 mL water after a meal. A washout period of at least 14 days separated administration of cyclo in the treatment periods.

group.title: Tacrolimus / Tacrolimus + Faldaprevir
group.description: fixed sequence group 2: single dose of 0.5 mg tac on Day 1 in period 1; treated with FDV 240 mg on Day -7 (loading dose) and 120 mg FDV on Days -6 to 7 and a single dose of 0.5 mg tac on Day 1 in period 2. Mode of administration: oral, with 240 mL water after a meal. A washout period of at least 14 days separated administration of cyclo in the treatment periods.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: AUC 0-infinity (Area Under the Concentration-time Curve of the Cyclo in Plasma Over the Time Interval From 0 Extrapolated to Infinity)
outcome.description: AUC 0-infinity (area under the concentration-time curve of the cyclo in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity). PK sampling (relative to the first cyclo administration [h:min]) Period 1: for cyclo 0:00h, 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 3:00h, 4:00h, 6:00h, 8:00h, 10:00h, 12:00h, 16:00h, 24:00h, 48:00h, 72:00h, 96:00h. period 2 for cyclo 0:00h, 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 3:00h, 4:00h, 6:00h, 8:00h, 10:00h, 12:00h, 16:00h, 24:00h, 48:00h, 72:00h, 96:00h, 120:00h, 144:00h, 168:00h.
outcome.population: pharmacokinetic set of cyclo (PKS cyclo): The subject set for the evaluation of PK endpoints was to include all treated subjects who provided at least 1 observation of cyclo in plasma for at least 1 primary endpoint, and who did not have important protocol violations with respect to the statistical evaluation of PK endpoints.

group.title: Cyclosporine
group.description: fixed sequence group 1: treated with cyclo 50 mg on Day 1 in period 1.

group.title: Cyclosporine + Faldaprevir
group.description: fixed sequence group 1: treated with FDV 240 mg on Day -7 and 120 mg FDV on Days -6 to 7; single dose of 50 mg cyclo on Day 1 in period 2.

measure.title: AUC 0-infinity (Area Under the Concentration-time Curve of the Cyclo in Plasma Over the Time Interval From 0 Extrapolated to Infinity)
measure.description: AUC 0-infinity (area under the concentration-time curve of the cyclo in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity). PK sampling (relative to the first cyclo administration [h:min]) Period 1: for cyclo 0:00h, 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 3:00h, 4:00h, 6:00h, 8:00h, 10:00h, 12:00h, 16:00h, 24:00h, 48:00h, 72:00h, 96:00h. period 2 for cyclo 0:00h, 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 3:00h, 4:00h, 6:00h, 8:00h, 10:00h, 12:00h, 16:00h, 24:00h, 48:00h, 72:00h, 96:00h, 120:00h, 144:00h, 168:00h.
measure.population: pharmacokinetic set of cyclo (PKS cyclo): The subject set for the evaluation of PK endpoints was to include all treated subjects who provided at least 1 observation of cyclo in plasma for at least 1 primary endpoint, and who did not have important protocol violations with respect to the statistical evaluation of PK endpoints.

analysis.groups_desc: Geometric mean (gMean) ratio of cyclo + FDV to cyclo treatment. The statistical model used for the analysis of primary endpoints was an analysis of variance (ANOVA) model on the logarithmic scale. This model accounted for variation from 'subject' and 'treatment' effects. The 'subject' effect was considered to be random, whereas the 'treatment' effect was considered as fixed.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Null hypothesis (H0): ratio is outside of interval (80%, 125%) vs. alternative hypothesis (H1): ratio is inside of interval (80%, 125%)
analysis.estimate_desc: ratio of cyclo + FDV to cyclo treatment. The standard error of the mean actually is the geometric coefficient of variation (%).

measure.title: AUC τ,ss (Area Under the Concentration-time Curve of the Analyte in Plasma at Steady State Over a Uniform Dosing Interval τ)
measure.description: AUC τ,ss (area under the concentration-time curve of the FDV in plasma at steady state over a uniform dosing interval τ). PK sampling (relative to the first cyclo administration [h:min]): period 2 For FDV -144:00h, -120:00h, -96:00h, -72:00h, -48:00h, -24:00h, -23:30h, -23:00h, -22:30h, -22:00h, -21:00h, -20:00h, -18:00h, -16:00h, -14:00h, -12:00h, -8:00h, 0:00h, 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 3:00h, 4:00h, 6:00h, 8:00h, 10:00h, 12:00h, 16:00h, 24:00h, 48:00h, 72:00h, 96:00h, 120:00h, 144:00h, 168:00h
measure.population: PKS cyclo + treated with FDV alone (arm: Faldaprevir) or started combination treatment FDV+cyclosporine in treatment period 2.

analysis.groups_desc: gMean ratio of cyclo+FDV to FDV treatment. The statistical model used for the analysis of primary endpoints was an analysis of variance (ANOVA) model on the logarithmic scale. This model accounted for variation from 'subject' and 'treatment' effects. The 'subject' effect was considered to be random, whereas the 'treatment' effect was considered as fixed.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: H0: ratio is outside of interval (80%, 125%) VS H1: ratio is inside of interval (80%, 125%)
analysis.estimate_desc: gMean ratio of cyclo+FDV to FDV treatment. The standard error of the mean actually is the geometric coefficient of variation (%).

outcome.title: AUC 0-infinity (Area Under the Concentration-time Curve of the Tac in Plasma Over the Time Interval From 0 Extrapolated to Infinity)
outcome.description: AUC 0-infinity (area under the concentration-time curve of the tac in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity). PK sampling (relative to the first tac administration): Period 1: for tac 0:00h, 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 3:00h, 4:00h, 6:00h, 8:00h, 10:00h, 12:00h, 16:00h, 24:00h, 48:00h, 72:00h, 96:00h, 144:00h, 168:00h, 192:00h period 2 for tac -192:00h, -168:00h, 0:00h, 0:30h, 1:00h, 1:30h, 2:00h, 3:00h, 4:00h, 6:00h, 8:00h, 10:00h, 12:00h, 16:00h, 24:00h, 48:00h, 72:00h, 96:00h, 120:00h, 144:00h, 168:00h
outcome.population: pharmacokinetic set of tac (PKS tac): The subject set for the evaluation of PK endpoints was to include all treated subjects who provided at least 1 observation of tac in plasma for at least 1 primary endpoint, and who did not have important protocol violations with respect to the statistical evaluation of PK endpoints.

group.title: Tacrolimus
group.description: fixed sequence group 2: treated with tac 0.5 mg on Day 1 in period 1.

group.title: Tacrolimus + Faldaprevir
group.description: fixed sequence group 2: treated with FDV 240 mg on Day -7 and 120 mg FDV on Days -6 to 7; single dose of 0.5 mg tac on Day 1 in period 2.

measure.title: AUC 0-infinity (Area Under the Concentration-time Curve of the Tac in Plasma Over the Time Interval From 0 Extrapolated to Infinity)

measure.population: pharmacokinetic set of tac (PKS tac): The subject set for the evaluation of PK endpoints was to include all treated subjects who provided at least 1 observation of tac in plasma for at least 1 primary endpoint, and who did not have important protocol violations with respect to the statistical evaluation of PK endpoints.

reported_events.time_frame: from the date of start trial medication to 28 days after the last trial medication.
reported_events.desc: Group 1: 16 subjects (sub) treated with cyclosporine (cyclo). After a washout phase the second period started. 15 sub. treated with Faldaprevir (FDV) (Day -7 to 7); 14 subjects treated with a cyclo on Day 1. Group 2: 15 of 16 sub. treated with tacrolimus (tac). After the washout in the second period 15 sub. were treated with FDV alone and FDV+tac.

group.title: Cyclosporine (Cyclo)
group.description: Cyclosporine (cyclo) 50 mg

group.title: Tacrolimus (Tac)
group.description: Tacrolimus (tac) 0.5 mg

group.title: FDV (ff Cyclo)
group.description: FDV 120 mg (followed by cyclosporine)

group.title: FDV (ff Tac)
group.description: FDV 120 mg (followed by tacrolimus)

group.title: Cyclo+FDV
group.description: Cyclosporine 50 mg + FDV 120 mg

group.title: Tac+FDV
group.description: Tacrolimus 0.5 mg + FDV 120 mg

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study. There IS an agreement between the Principal Investigator and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
